snippet.textDisplay: This is crazy, he stopped when told, the teacher is a snitch!﻿

Good Lord. Do you REALLY believe a kid should get a sexual assault notation 
on his record? For THIS? I don't give a damn what the circumstances are,

DO YOUR JOB. ﻿

Maybe I'm missing something but I dont see how this goes on his criminal

I am a teacher and I LOVE hugs from my kids (Kindergarten)! We as a staff 
however, do not hug students older than 5th grade in our school (it goes up 
to 8th). I can understand in a high school why she wouldn't want him to hug 
her like that- it could be perceived as they are in a relationship and she 
might not want to be accused of sexually assaulting HIM. Or, she could just 
be a jerk. I agree the suspension is harsh.﻿

So when teachers hug me (without asking) i could get them fired from 
educating for a year? No. It seems that students compared to teachers are 
worthless pieces of shit﻿

But why does it say "Black Student"? What did his color have to do with 
it? ﻿

(In this case the identification of the "perp" as black, is an effort to

facts are,....
*Thoughts?* ﻿

First of all I know this young man personility and his mother, he was my 
sons best friend but me and my family moved to a different part of atlanta, 
this young man is a very well brought up young man he was raised right he 
is very well mannered very respectfull and this case should be looked into 
very closelly and take it from me he didn't mean nothing negitive by that 
hug thats just his personility he's a good kid all around, to the teacher I 
think the teacher might be taking this alittle bit to far and need to check 
herself really! being that I know this young man. ﻿

From what I read of thr story and from what I seen from the video I don't 
think at issue is the initial hug but what transpired seconds afterwards. 
The problem is inappropriate intimate contact from a student and teacher. 
You see in the video that he slighty tilts his face inward her neck and it 
seems as if at that moment his lips and cheek could have possibly touch the 
teachers neck. At the point, its inappropriate contact cause it intimate 
like a kiss on the neck. Afterwards you see not olny the expression of the 
teachers face of shock but as well as her pushing the student away with her 
right arm.

Perception is a very fickle thing so its pretty much up to the viewer to 
make their own judgement but since there has been a history with the 
student doing this and being told not to hug his teachers again this matter 
because its was uncomfortable for them and at times inappropriate, I think 
it's safe to say he was given ample warning and that he crossed the line 
but if he's a good student meaning that he has good grades and no serious 
disciplinary problems I don't think they should punish him by not allowing 
him to walk for graduation. Maybe he should take a class on proper contact 
and etiquette and do some community service. And limited contact with said 
teacher until he graduates. This punishment is nothing more than just to 
send a message, the problem with that is it seems more personal for the 
school and not something that's more beneficial for both parties involved.﻿

+Cliff Yablonski Well until the records are release publicly, its all 
conjecture. It most likely relates to the inappropriate contact he's had 
with his teachers as stated by the school. No doubt if this student had 
serious behavioral and disciplinary issues, he would have most likely been 
either expelled, transferred or even arrested. 

Secondly it's because of this specific incident that lead to this 
aggressive punishment of suspension from the last days of school (which 
will prevent him from finishing his final classes) after suspected previous 
incidents as well as warnings he failed to heed. Thus he will not be able 
to graduate. Like i said before, this won't be beneficial to both parties 
because the student will then have to make up classes in the summer or the 
next school year in most likely the same school around the same teachers 
and administrators agitated by his touchy feely behavior. 


Much longer then they would have had to deal with this student if instead 
he were isolated with different teachers, took mandatory classes on proper 
contact and etiquette and do community service. This way the student would 
get his credits, graduate and be gone from school, far away. The student 
has the right to defend himself and his actions by being allow to tell his 
side of the story even the video evidence plus his suspected previous 
incidents and warnings are damning.


Finally, you're entitled to your's by all mean's but in my opinion niglet 
or cracklet is no fair way designate person, i'm just saying.
